revised_title: Observations and Analysis of Branched a-Ray Tracks
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study branched a-ray tracks using an expansion apparatus. They discovered that about 1 in every 300 tracks showed branching, and the shapes and sizes of the branches were very similar. The authors also found that the branching occurred near the end of the a-ray path and the angle between the branches did not differ much. The nature of these branched tracks remains a topic of speculation and further research is needed to understand the phenomenon.
